channel.title: ubuntu on DW Blog
channel.description: Recent content in ubuntu on DW Blog

item.title: Matlab Installation in Ubuntu (Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS)
item.description: MATLAB installation in Ubuntu (Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS) Overview MATLAB is a powerful programming language/software when it comes to matrix computing. Although it is not a open-source software, as a bioinformatician, I still need to use it sometimes for my research. In this blog, I will introduce how to install MATLAB in your local machine with Ubuntu as your OS. Procedure Firstly, we have to download a version of MATLAB that is suitable for your work and your hardware.

item.title: Ubuntu Notes (keep updating)
item.description: Overview Installation Issues Reference Overview Ubuntu is a Linux distribution which is an open-source operating system. Compared to other operating systems, Linux supported by a group of qualified developers offers stable and secure but flexible system for users. In other words, users can customize the OS with any open-source software and modifications of OS itself. Because it does not track any digital footprint, Linux is hard to be hacked by using backdoor and infected by virus.

item.title: Jupyterlab on Linux Server
item.description: Jupyterlab on linux server Overview Installation Virtual environment Issues Reference Overview Jupyterlab is a lightweight but comprehensive and full-development IDE. In addition to write scripts with nice highlights syntax for Python and R as I know, the notebook is probably the most well-known feature with which users are able to write codes along with markdown-style notes. Besides, if you are a user who tends to install as less softwares/packages on your local machine as possible, running Jupyterlab on remote server may be suitable for you.

item.title: Chinese Input Methods for Ubuntu
item.description: Overview Popular input methods Installation for iBus chewing Issues Additional Reference Overview As a Taiwanese, Chinese input methods are essential for my daily communication with my friends and family. I used to type Chinese/Mandarin with Microsoft Chinese Pinyin input that is quite good for me. Unfortunately, there is no any alternaltive that has the same performance in Ubuntu or other Linux distro. Reluctantly, we will introduce popular input methods working fine on Ubuntu in this blog, and I will provide the way I followed to install and configure the methods.
